description: Vanadium is a hard, silvery metal primarily used to strengthen steel alloys. Even small amounts greatly improve durability, making vanadium steel important for tools, construction materials, and aerospace components. It also plays a role in batteries, especially vanadium redox flow systems for large-scale energy storage. In chemistry, vanadium compounds act as catalysts in various industrial processes. Its versatility and enhancing effect on materials make vanadium a key component in modern engineering.
name: Vanadium
